name: attenuating
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
causing something to become less or weaker: The substance was found to have an attenuating effect on nicotine withdrawal. See
attenuate formal
More examplesFewer examplesNotice the attenuating force of 'a bit' in "That's a bit too much."The material is highly attenuating, meaning it absorbs and lessens sound going through it.Exhaustion had an attenuating effect on her feelings.
